Package com.project.CyShare.controller

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
com.project.CyShare.controller.UserController
@RestController public class UserController extends Object
This controller is used to perform actions regarding users (add, delete, find, assign car, etc.)
Author:
Hugo Alvarez Valdivia, Bhuwan Joshi

  • Method Details

    • GetAllUsers

      @GetMapping("users/all") List<User> GetAllUsers() throws Exception
      Mapping used to return a list of all users saved in the database.
      Returns:
      List of all users.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • AddUserByPath

      @PostMapping("users/add/{n}/{p}/{r}") String AddUserByPath(@PathVariable String n, @PathVariable String p, @PathVariable Role r) throws Exception
      This post mapping is used to add a new user via path variables. Only here for demonstration purposes. For this project we'll be using JSON body anyways.
      Parameters:
      n - Username
      p - Password
      Returns:
      Success message
      Throws:
      Exception

    • AddUser

      @PostMapping("users/add") public String AddUser(@RequestBody User newUser) throws Exception
      Post mapping that will utilize a JSON body request to add a new user into the database.
      Parameters:
      newUser - User objects to be added to database.
      Returns:
      Success/failure message.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • RemoveUser

      @DeleteMapping("users/remove") public String RemoveUser(@RequestBody User user)
      Delete mapping to remove a user from the database.
      Parameters:
      user - User to be deleted.
      Returns:
      Success/failure message.

    • GetUsersByRole

      @GetMapping("users/role/{role}") public List<User> GetUsersByRole(@PathVariable Role role)
      This mapping is used to find all users that have a certain role. For example, can be used to return all current DRIVERS or PASSENGERS.
      Parameters:
      role - Role to search
      Returns:
      List of all users that have that role assigned.

    • updateRole

      @PutMapping("users/{id}/role") public String updateRole(@PathVariable long userId, @RequestBody Role role) throws Exception
      This method changes the current role for the given user.
      Parameters:
      userId - ID for user to make changes.
      role - New role for said user.
      Returns:
      Success/failure message.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • updateLocation

      @PutMapping("/users/{userId}/Maps/{mapId}") public void updateLocation(@PathVariable long userId, @PathVariable long mapId) throws Exception
      This controller is used to keep the current location of a user updated in the database.
      Parameters:
      userId - id number of the user to be updated.
      mapId - id number of the location to be assigned.
      Throws:
      Exception - Exception

    • getUser

      @GetMapping("/users/userName/{userName}") public User getUser(@PathVariable String userName) throws Exception
      This controller returns a user object just by inputting the userName
      Parameters:
      userName - userName of the user to be found.
      Returns:
      User object
      Throws:
      Exception - Exception

    • assignCarPath

      @PutMapping("/users/{userId}/cars/{carId}") public String assignCarPath(@PathVariable long userId, @PathVariable long carId) throws Exception
      This method assigns an already existing car to a user using path variables
      Parameters:
      carId - Car to assign.
      userId - User for the car.
      Returns:
      Success/failure message.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • assignCar

      @PutMapping(path="/users/addcar/{userName}") public String assignCar(@RequestBody Car car, @PathVariable String userName) throws Exception
      This is an alternative to the assign car by path controller. It takes the userName instead of the id number.
      Parameters:
      car - Car entity to assign.
      userName - userName of user that will get the car assigned.
      Returns:
      Success/failure message.
      Throws:
      Exception - Exception
